orderedaa



class OrderedAA(K, I);
A simplistic implementation of an ordered associative array.

This is built on top of a normal associative array which keeps track of the indices into a regular array. Items that are added are always appended to the array, and it's index added (or updated) in the associative array holding the keys.

For items that are updated, the index is looked up in the associative array if it exists and the item is updated in the array, in place. It is added if they key does not exist in the associative array.

alias Comparator = bool delegate(K, K);
The delegate declaration for the sorting comparison function.

size_t add(const K key, I item);
Adds a new item to this array. This function will always add a new item, and will not update any old one by the same key if present.

Params:
K key They key to add.
I item They item to add.

Returns:
The index of the item that was added.

size_t update(const K key, I item);
Updates an item in this array. This function will replace an already existing item if present, otherwise it will add it to the end of the array.

Params:
K key They key to update.
I item They item to update.

Returns:
The index of the item that was added.

void sort();
Sorts the items in this array by their keys.

void sort(Comparator comp);
Sorts the items in this array by their keys. A comparator delegate can be passed in that will handle the sorting comparisons.

Params:
Comparator comp the comparator delegate. See OrderedAA.Comparator.

bool contains(const K key);
Returns:
true if an item with the specified key is present in this array.

I get(const K key, I def);
Returns an item from this array, or a default value if the item does not exist.

Params:
K key They key of the item to return.
I def They default value to return if the key is not present in this array.

Returns:
The item with the specified key.

void clear();
Empties the contents of this array.

@property size_t length();
Describes the number of items in this array.

int opApply(int delegate(ref I) dg);
foreach iterator for the obejcts in this array.

int opApply(int delegate(ref int, ref I) dg);
foreach iterator for the index and objects in this array.

I opIndex(const size_t index);
Index function for an integer value.

I opIndex(const K key);
Index function for a key.
